conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the latch D in the self-locking state.
Identify the forces acting on the latch D: spring force kx, normal force N, and frictional force f.
Resolve the spring force kx into components parallel and perpendicular to the inclined surface of the latch D.
Component of spring force parallel to inclined surface is kx sin θ; perpendicular component is kx cos θ.
Write equilibrium equations for latch D: perpendicular N = kx cos θ; parallel frictional force f must balance kx sin θ.
Maximum static friction force f_max = μN; for self-locking, f = kx sin θ and f ≤ μN.
Substitute N = kx cos θ into frictional force equation: kx sin θ ≤ μ(kx cos θ).
Simplify inequality: sin θ ≤ μ cos θ; solve for μ: μ ≥ tan θ.
Determine normal force N from equilibrium condition perpendicular to inclined surface: N = kx cos θ.
Final answer: magnitude of normal force between locking tongue D and locking groove E is kx √3/2.
